description: Documentation of participation in the European Cybersecurity Alert System, including contributions to detection, analysis, and data processing capabilities for cyber threats and incident prevention in the Union
auditor_questions: Show me evidence of your participation in the European Cybersecurity Alert System
How do you contribute to pooling relevant data and information on cyber threats and incidents?
What advanced tools and technologies (e.g., AI, data analytics) do you deploy to support threat detection?
How do you share actionable cyber threat intelligence with Cross-Border Cyber Hubs?

maturity_levels.basic: Participation agreement signed, basic data sharing established
maturity_levels.intermediate: Active contribution of threat intelligence, regular data pooling, advanced analytics tools deployed
maturity_levels.advanced: AI-driven threat detection, real-time intelligence sharing, proactive alerting and concrete recommendations to entities

requirement_summary: National Cyber Hub designation and capabilities
description: Documentation of National Cyber Hub designation, demonstrating capacity to act as reference point for collecting and analysing cyber threat information, and capability to detect, aggregate, and analyse data using state-of-the-art technologies
auditor_questions: Show me the designation or establishment documentation for the National Cyber Hub
How does the Hub serve as a gateway for collecting and analysing information from public and private organisations?
What state-of-the-art technologies are deployed for threat detection and data analysis?
How do you cooperate with private sector entities for exchanging relevant data on cyber threats?

maturity_levels.basic: Hub designated, basic data collection and analysis capability established
maturity_levels.intermediate: Public-private cooperation frameworks in place, sensor and telemetry data integrated, regular threat analysis produced
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time threat detection and aggregation, AI-powered analysis, comprehensive public-private threat intelligence ecosystem

description: Hosting consortium agreement and operating procedures for Cross-Border Cyber Hubs, including multi-national cooperation arrangements, shared tools and infrastructure procurement, and information exchange protocols with the CSIRTs network
auditor_questions: Show me the hosting consortium agreement for the Cross-Border Cyber Hub
How do participating National Cyber Hubs share threat intelligence across borders?
What jointly procured tools and infrastructure are deployed for cross-border threat detection?
How is information shared with the CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe?

maturity_levels.basic: Consortium agreement signed, basic cross-border information sharing established
maturity_levels.intermediate: Jointly procured tools operational, structured intelligence sharing protocols, regular cross-border exercises
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time cross-border situational awareness, automated threat correlation across Member States, integrated EU-wide early warning

requirement_summary: EU Cybersecurity Reserve funding and procurement
description: Documentation of funding arrangements with the European Cybersecurity Competence Centre, including grant agreements, joint procurement of tools and infrastructure, hosting and usage agreements, and compliance with co-funding requirements (50% acquisition, 50% operations)
auditor_questions: Show me the grant agreement and hosting and usage agreement with ECCC
How do you comply with the co-funding requirements for acquisition and operational costs?
What tools, infrastructure, or services were jointly procured through the ECCC?
Was the National Cyber Hub integrated into a Cross-Border Cyber Hub within 2 years as required?

maturity_levels.basic: Grant agreement executed, co-funding requirements met, basic tools procured
maturity_levels.intermediate: Joint procurement completed, hosting and usage agreement actively managed, regular financial reporting to ECCC
maturity_levels.advanced: Full utilisation of procured capabilities, cross-border integration achieved, proactive participation in ECCC mapping exercises

requirement_summary: Trusted providers for EU Cybersecurity Reserve
description: Evidence of selection and certification as a trusted provider for the EU Cybersecurity Reserve, including demonstration of expertise, independence, and compliance with applicable EU and national law requirements for providing managed security services
retention_period: Duration of trusted provider status + 5 years
auditor_questions: Show me evidence of selection as a trusted provider for the EU Cybersecurity Reserve
How do you demonstrate the required level of expertise for incident response services?
How do you ensure independence and avoid conflicts of interest in providing emergency response?
What safeguards are in place for handling sensitive information encountered during incident response?

maturity_levels.basic: Trusted provider status obtained, basic incident response capability demonstrated
maturity_levels.intermediate: Established track record of incident response, independence safeguards documented, confidentiality procedures in place
maturity_levels.advanced: Leading incident response capability, multi-sector expertise, automated confidentiality and conflict-of-interest management

description: Documented procedures for requesting and providing mutual assistance between Member States in the event of significant or large-scale cybersecurity incidents, including operational cooperation arrangements and resource sharing protocols
auditor_questions: Show me the mutual assistance procedures for cross-border cybersecurity incidents
How do you coordinate with other Member States' CSIRTs during a significant incident?
What resources can you deploy to assist another Member State under mutual assistance?
Show me evidence of mutual assistance exercises or actual activations

maturity_levels.basic: Mutual assistance procedures documented, contact points established
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular cross-border exercises conducted, resource sharing agreements in place, operational cooperation tested
maturity_levels.advanced: Rapid-response mutual assistance capability, pre-positioned resources, automated coordination platform

description: Post-incident review documentation for significant or large-scale cybersecurity incidents, including assessment of threat actors, root causes, vulnerabilities exploited, lessons learned, and recommendations for improving Union cyber posture
auditor_questions: Show me the post-incident review report for the most recent significant cybersecurity incident
How did you assess the threat actors and root causes of the incident?
What lessons learned were identified and how were they communicated?
How were recommendations from the review incorporated into operational improvements?

maturity_levels.basic: Post-incident reviews conducted for significant incidents with basic findings documented
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured review methodology, root cause analysis, lessons learned systematically captured and shared with relevant authorities
maturity_levels.advanced: Comprehensive multi-stakeholder reviews, threat intelligence correlation, recommendations fed into EU-wide policy improvements

description: Log of cyber threat alerts generated and disseminated through the European Cybersecurity Alert System, including detection timestamps, threat categorisation, recommended actions, and dissemination to CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe
auditor_questions: Show me the alert log including detection and dissemination timestamps for the past quarter
How do you categorise and prioritise cyber threat alerts?
How are alerts disseminated to the CSIRTs network and EU-CyCLONe?
What concrete recommendations were provided to affected entities based on alerts?

maturity_levels.basic: Alerts generated and logged with basic categorisation
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured alert taxonomy, automated dissemination, recommendations included with each alert
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time alert correlation, predictive alerting, automated entity-specific recommendations, full EU situational awareness
